bill_title: to appropriate money for the expenses of the legislative, judicial, and executive departments of the state, certain officers, boards, and departments, for support and maintenance of the educational, charitable, and penal institutions, the South Dakota Veterans' Home, for maintenance of the state house, and for support and maintenance of the state guard.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to appropriate money for the expenses of the legislative, judicial, and executive departments of the state, certain officers, boards, and departments, for support and maintenance of the educational, charitable, and penal institutions, the South Dakota Veterans' Home, for maintenance of the state house, and for support and maintenance of the state guard. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated the following sums of money, or so much thereof as may be necessary, out of any money in the state treasury not otherwise appropriated, for the ordinary expenses of the legislative, judicial, and executive departments of the state, certain officers, boards and departments, and for support and maintenance of the educational, charitable, and penal institutions, the South Dakota Veterans' Home, the state house, and the state guard for the fiscal year ending June 30, 1998. GENERAL FEDERAL OTHER TOTAL FUNDS FUNDS FUNDS FUNDS F.T.E. SECTION 2. The state treasurer is directed to transfer to the state general fund money from the following funds for the purpose herein indicated: Section 27. The state treasurer shall transfer to the state general fund twelve million dollars ($12,000,000) from the cement plant fund. Section 28. The special committee created by chapter 4-8A may, upon recommendation of the Governor and a majority vote of all members of the special committee, establish the maximum salary or per diem compensation and allowable expenses that may be paid to members of state boards, councils, commissions, and advisory bodies created by law during the Seventy-second Legislative Session or created by an executive order of the Governor for purposes of setting policy.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to appropriate money for the expenses of the legislative, judicial, and executive departments of the state, certain officers, boards, and departments, for support and maintenance of the educational, charitable, and penal institutions, the South Dakota Veterans' Home, for maintenance of the state house, and for support and maintenance of the state guard. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated the following sums of money, or so much thereof as may be necessary, out of any money in the state treasury not otherwise appropriated, for the ordinary expenses of the legislative, judicial, and executive departments of the state, certain officers, boards and departments, and for support and maintenance of the educational, charitable, and penal institutions, the South Dakota Veterans' Home, the state house, and the state guard for the fiscal year ending June 30, 1998. Section 26. The state treasurer is directed to transfer to the state general fund money from the following funds for the purpose herein indicated: Section 27. The state treasurer shall transfer to the state general fund twelve million dollars ($12,000,000) from the cement plant fund. Section 28. The special committee created by chapter 4-8A may, upon recommendation of the Governor and a majority vote of all members of the special committee, establish the maximum salary or per diem compensation and allowable expenses that may be paid to members of state boards, councils, commissions, and advisory bodies created by law during the Seventy-second Legislative Session or created by an executive order of the Governor for purposes of setting policy. BILL HISTORY 1/29/97 First read in House and referred to Appropriations. H.J. 201 2/14/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/14/97 Appropriations Deferred to another day. H.J. 483 2/18/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/19/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date.
